solution_line_template: Of {total_students} students who attended class, half wore colored lipstick, or {total_students}/{half_divisor}=<<{total_students}/{half_divisor}={students_with_lipstick}>>{students_with_lipstick} students wore colored lipstick.

Of those students who wore lipstick, one quarter wore red lipstick, or {students_with_lipstick}/{quarter_divisor}=<<{students_with_lipstick}/{quarter_divisor}={students_with_red_lipstick}>>{students_with_red_lipstick} students wore red lipstick.

Since there were one-fifth as many students wearing blue lipstick as were wearing red lipstick, then {students_with_red_lipstick}/{fifth_divisor}=<<{students_with_red_lipstick}/{fifth_divisor}={students_with_blue_lipstick}>>{students_with_blue_lipstick} students wore blue lipstick.
